intro: Couepia habrantha, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and other nightshades. The plant features woody stems and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Couepia habrantha is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
